text: Napa or napa cabbage (Brassica rapa subsp. pekinensis or Brassica rapa Pekinensis) is a type of Chinese cabbage. It came from near Beijing, China. It is used in East Asian cuisine. It can be found in Europe, the Americas and Australia. In almost every country, it is called "Chinese cabbage". ==References== Category:Leaf vegetables Category:Brassicaceae
title: Napa cabbage
